description:
http://logs.openstack.org/81/181781/3/check/check-tempest-dsvm-multinode-full/e13a3a8/logs/screen-n-cond.txt.gz?level=TRACE

2015-06-08 20:37:00.205 WARNING nova.scheduler.utils [req-73a672be-7fe7-4bb4-a13c-6c1bbe6eb3d6 ServerDiskConfigTestJSON-326631053 ServerDiskConfigTestJSON-280407802] Failed to compute_task_migrate_server: No valid host was found. There are not enough hosts available.
Traceback (most recent call last):

  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/oslo_messaging/rpc/server.py", line 142, in inner
    return func(*args, **kwargs)

  File "/opt/stack/new/nova/nova/scheduler/manager.py", line 86, in select_destinations
    filter_properties)

  File "/opt/stack/new/nova/nova/scheduler/filter_scheduler.py", line 89, in select_destinations
    raise exception.NoValidHost(reason=reason)

NoValidHost: No valid host was found. There are not enough hosts available.

http://logstash.openstack.org/#

There really isn't much in the compute logs for errors except this:

http://logs.openstack.org/81/181781/3/check/check-tempest-dsvm-multinode-full/e13a3a8/logs/screen-n-cpu.txt.gz?level=TRACE#_2015-06-08_20_24_45_822

2015-06-08 20:24:45.822 ERROR nova.compute.manager [req-5e3903be-18a7-4aa4-b874-f7116bac6e43 None None] No compute node record for host devstack-trusty-2-node-rax-iad-2929470.slave.openstack.org

But that's not even at the same time.

I see this in the n-api logs around the same time as the failures:

http://logs.openstack.org/81/181781/3/check/check-tempest-dsvm-multinode-full/e13a3a8/logs/screen-n-api.txt.gz?level=TRACE#_2015-06-08_20_35_01_485

015-06-08 20:35:01.485 WARNING nova.compute.api [req-eec9e9fb-8794-47cc-a67a-f60b3dd85ab4 MigrationsAdminTest-1879224794 MigrationsAdminTest-93634600] [instance: 24d02424-1af8-43b8-941c-507806a22e79] instance's host devstack-trusty-2-node-rax-iad-2929470.slave.openstack.org is down, deleting from database
title: check-tempest-dsvm-multinode-full fails due to 'Failed to compute_task_migrate_server: No valid host was found'

comments.content:
This is a query that hits just the multinode job:

http://logstash.openstack.org/#
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mriedem

comments.content: We don't seem to see that API warning before 6/1.  logstash only goes back 10 days so maybe something happened after that, but this is also not a high percentage hit, there are days where this isn't hit at all.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mriedem

comments.content: @Eli Qiao: Since you are set as assignee, I'll set this bug to "In Progress".
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mzoeller

comments.content: Looks like MigrationsAdminTest resizes a VM, so removing live-migration tag
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~pawel-koniszewski

comments.content:
Need a better error detail for what causes this one. Looks a bit like a clock/time mismatch between hosts, where one node writes such an old timestamp into the DB it's considered dead.

Marking as incomplete until we see this causing issues again.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~johngarbutt

comments.content: [Expired for OpenStack Compute (nova) because there has been no activity for 60 days.]
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~janitor
